name: Tang Dunhoang
description: Dunhuang is a place on the edge of the Tang Dynasty’s border. It is famous for the buddhist caves with a large number of colored wall paintings. Due to its location, the paintings shows a mixture of style between central Asia and China. This bow is based on paintings of these caves. It is similar the Tang bows, but with even shorter limbs, which means faster arrow speed. String Length: 1.28 Meter (Short version), 1.38 Meter (Regular version), 1.44 Meter (Long version). Draw length: up to 32’’ (Regular) and up to 35'' (Long)

name: Tang Dunhoang (Long version)
description: The long version of Tang Dunhoang

name: Tang Changan
description: Specially designed for long draw, this bow can easily and smoothly sustain a draw length up to 35inchs, while the asymmetrical design helps to further stabilizes the arrow. Fully extend your back, draw behind your ear, and feel the power! String Length: 1.52 Meter. Draw length: up to 35inchs

name: Ming Kaiyuan
description: The “Kaiyuan” bow, with a distinctive hook-like siyah (which can be used to hook up arrows), probably appeared around the 15th century. The origin was probably central Asia. There are archery manuals describing picking up arrows from horseback with the bow’s hooked siyah. There are two versions of this bow, the regular version and the horse bow version. String Length: short bow 1.26 Meter/ long bow1.36 Meter. Draw length: up to 31’’ horse bow and up to 33’’ regular bow. *Take-Down Available*(for long bow only, Maximum 40#@28'')

name: Mongol Kheshig
description: The Kheshig Mongol Bow is inspired by the bows used by the Mongol army in the 13th century. These bows are featured with long siyah and wide limbs. The wide limb makes it very stable thus the bow may shoot more accurately than other bows, if used properly. String Length: 1.38 meter

name: Tang Loulan
description: Our Tang Loulan bow is based on many historical paintings and a few surviving artifacts. It is on the larger size for the long-siya-short-limb bows for stability, yet the prominent recurve shape still let it have a good arrow speed. The Loulan has wider limbs than the other bows of the similar design. The wider limb provides more stability for the release. String Length: 1.37 Meter. Unstrung Bow Length (siyah to siyah): 1.34 Meter. Draw length: up to 32inchs.

name: Tibetan Qinghai
description: The tibetan bow is based on the bows currently being used by the Tibetan people of the Qinghai province. This bow reflects influence from the Manchu bows, featuring a prominently reflexed siyah and a string bridge. It is shorter than the Manchu bow, making it a little easier to handle while having a comparatively powerful punch. It prefers slightly heavier arrows. String Length: 1.36 meter.

name: Turkish Bow
description: The famous turkish bow is used in the Ottoman Empire. It is one of the shortest bow in history. The short limbs give it superior power when shooting lighter arrows over long distance, while the unique outward-bulging grip make it more comfortable to hold for many archers. Unstrung Bow Length (siyah to siyah): 1 Meter. Draw length: up to 29inchs

name: Tatar Bow
description: The world famous Crimean Tatar Bow! String Length: 1.15 Meter short and 1.32 Meter long. Unstrung Bow Length from siyah to siyah: 1.15 Meter short and 1.25 Meter Long. Draw length: up to 30inchs short and up to 32inchs long

name: Ming Emperor
description: This bow is an interpretation of the bow carried by Emperor Wanli (1563-1620) of the Ming dynasty, in a painting depicting him going to pay tribute to the ancestral tombs of the royal family. String Length: 1.3 Meter. Draw length: up to 32inchs.

name: Han Bow
description: This kind of long siyah, short limb bows were used widely in Asia between 200 BC and 1300 AD. To make this bow perfect, we applied the best materiel and design we can come up with now. This bow can sustain a 31inchs draw. String Length: 1.30 Meter. Unstrung Bow Length: 1.30 Meter.

name: Xuanwu Bow
description: String Length: 1.4 meter. Draw Weight @28'': 20 to 70lbs @28inchs. Maximum Safe Draw Length: 33'' for 40lbs@28'' or lighter. 31'' for 45lbs@28'' or heavier.
